event.descr:
Generic Clarent error trap: Severity: Critical(0), Major(1), Minor(2), Warning(3), or Information(4) Class: Configuration(0), Hardware(1), or Software(2) Number of trap Count of total number of traps per class Descriptive text string

trapSeverity %parm[#1]%; critical(0) major(1) minor(2) warning(3) information(4)

trapClass %parm[#2]%; configuration(0) hardware(1) software(2)

trapNumber %parm[#3]%;

trapCount %parm[#4]%;

trapText %parm[#5]%;
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: clarentInfo trap received trapSeverity=%parm[#1]% trapClass=%parm[#2]% trapNumber=%parm[#3]% trapCount=%parm[#4]% trapText=%parm[#5]%

event.descr:
Software update: Name of package Package operation: Download(0), Unpack(1), Install(2), Prepare(3), Commit(4), Abort(5), Delete(8) Package operation status Error count

packageName %parm[#1]%;

packageOperation %parm[#2]%; download(0) unpack(1) install(2) prepare(3) commit(4) abort(5) load(6) delete(8)

packageStatus %parm[#3]%; phaseComplete(0) phaseError(1) phaseStarted(2) phaseNotStarted(3)

errorCount %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: softwareUpdate trap received packageName=%parm[#1]% packageOperation=%parm[#2]% packageStatus=%parm[#3]% errorCount=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
Call placed to the intercept number

trapText %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: numberIntercept trap received trapText=%parm[#1]%

event.descr: Clarent ThroughPacket server is down
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: tpIsDown trap received

event.descr: Clarent ThroughPacket server failed to restart
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: restartTPFailed trap received

event.descr: Clarent ThroughPacket server restarted successfully
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: tpRestarted trap received

event.descr:
Clarent ThreshHold Trap, indicates that a particular Threshold has been exceeded or rearmed by the named Application. This trap contains 1) The Severity of the Threshold (Critical, Major, Minor, Warning, Information) 2) the name of the Application (e.g. ThroughPacket) 3) the ThreshHold Name (e.g. PacketsperSecond, BytesPerSecond ) 4) the ThreshHold Value that was exceeded/rearmed ( e.g. 350000 ) 5) the current value of the variable being sampled. ( e.g. BytesPerSecond 355043 ) 6) the Action, Exceeded or Rearmed. Thresholds are rearmed when the moving average of the variable being measured is at 75% of the ThreshHold.

trapSeverity %parm[#1]%; critical(0) major(1) minor(2) warning(3) information(4)

trapAppName %parm[#2]%;

threshHoldName %parm[#3]%;

threshHoldValue %parm[#4]%;

currentValue %parm[#5]%;

threshHoldAction %parm[#6]%; exceeded(0) rearmed(1)
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: threshHoldTrap trap received trapSeverity=%parm[#1]% trapAppName=%parm[#2]% threshHoldName=%parm[#3]% threshHoldValue=%parm[#4]% currentValue=%parm[#5]% threshHoldAction=%parm[#6]%

event.descr:
The system is rebooting in response to a startShutdown command

trapText %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: systemReboot trap received trapText=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
The system has been enabled to receive a startShutdown command

trapText %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: rebootCommand trap received trapText=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
Drive has less than 50MB of free space available. This trap is issued on an hourly basis if the condition persists.

trapText %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: cDiskSpaceLow trap received trapText=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
Clarent Connect partner does not have a route for this call. This trap is issued no more than once every 5 minutes.

trapText %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: cNoConnectRoute trap received trapText=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
Clarent DB error trap contains the following information Severity: Critical(0), Major(1), Minor(2), Warning(3), or Information(4) Database error number Descriptive error text string Count of total number of database error traps sent since machine power up

trapSeverity %parm[#1]%; critical(0) major(1) minor(2) warning(3) information(4)

trapNumber %parm[#2]%;

trapText %parm[#3]%;

trapCount %parm[#4]%;
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: dbError trap received trapSeverity=%parm[#1]% trapNumber=%parm[#2]% trapText=%parm[#3]% trapCount=%parm[#4]%

event.descr:
A new database clerk was started. The value of trapNumber represents the total number of clerks running.

trapNumber %parm[#1]%;
event.logmsg: Clarent Event: dbClerkStarted trap received trapNumber=%parm[#1]%

event.descr:
Clarent Gatekeeper changed operational state. Operational states are: disabled (0), enabled (1).

event.descr:
Clarent Gatekeeper load state is critical. Load states are: Minimal (0), Light (1), Medium (2), Heavy (3), Dangerously Heavy (4), and Critical (5).
